page.title: 12THE DEWEY MUSEUM, WARMINSTER
page.content: Inside Warminster's new Library is a Museum, with a workroom, storeroom and public display area run by the local History Society. Its collection of local material has come about mainly through donations, but the displays and conservation work are paid for by the Society, partly supported by the County Council. Volunteer Museum Curator Mr Jack Field is putting on special displays in 1985 for the 40th anniversary of VE Day, and for a Deverill Valley Festival. Apart from the Museum, the Society arranges lectures and outings for members, and in 1984 published a book of old photographs of the town. Mr Field believes the town has a fascinating history unharmed by recent building developments; but he will be keeping an eye on the new by-pass "to see what turns up"!
